channel.name: ZkProgram: Printing an async value goes through but returning it as CircuitString  fails the method?

messages.content: Changed the channel name: ZkProgram: Printing an async value goes through but returning it as CircuitString  fails the method?
You can see https://github.com/MinaFoundation/Core-Grants/pull/4

embeds.title: RFC-0003: Asynchronous Circuits in `o1js` by teddyjfpender · Pull R...
embeds.description:
🚀 Introduction to the Innovation
Here is RFC-0003! It's about bringing asynchronous circuits to o1js. This enhancement is set to significantly improve zkApp design patterns and eliminate work-a...

messages.content: This is such a relief lol, thank you 😄
methods cannot be async
If you want to have an async value in circuit just fetch it before calling of the method and pass it as private input.
Yeah, I just wanted to see if I can rather create a verifiable proof for an arbitrary code with some async calls 😄  Thanks though

Async methods are coming pretty soon though!! This is the snarky part: https://github.com/o1-labs/snarky/pull/836
I'm planning on doing the o1js part next week
@gregor how does the mental model work for an async function in a circuit?

not really different from an async function in general I'd say.
the only difference will be, your method can have the `async` keyword and everything still works. so it expands the things you can do within it.

it can be really useful even for o1js internally! for example, right now we have this hack for "fetching with a synchronous function" i.e. `this.state.get()`, by running the circuits twice to first find out what to fetch, then fetching, then reading from a cache when running the second time. I've seen people be surprised and annoyed by their circuits running multiple times uncountable times.

It'll be so much nicer when we can get rid of that and just fetch account data right in the circuit!
A method is still just a JS function that builds up a constraint system internally. Just more powerful if that function can be async

Right this is what I'm wrestling with.  So it's just the method that generates the constraint that can be async, but the constraints themselves can't all of a sudden wait for inputs?  I imagine when you're ready to "invoke" a circuit (I'm not sure what the right verb is here.  Prove something?), you need to have all the inputs ready.  But as you're building the circuit, you can await some promise?

Yes that's right! There are two steps when you prove: First you run the JS code to generate "the witness", which is a long list of gates (= equations) with your witnesses (field elements) occupying the "slots" (variables) in those gates. So the output of running your circuit is a big table. And this is the _input_ to the PLONK protocol / the kimchi prover which then does crypto stuff like treating each column of field elements as polynomial, committing to it, creating an opening proof, etc. All that heavy zk proving stuff happens after your async JS code long finished running
@teddy hey there, I saw the merge and pulls on the Mina-Foundation/Core-Grants, does this mean async circuits are up and running? When will they be released? Thank you :)
You can see pull request https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/pull/1450

Starts to address MinaFoundation/Core-Grants#4
This is the first step of supporting async circuits. It does not yet support async methods in contracts / zkprogram, but brings significant internal c...

messages.content: I hope this means it will be released with the next version of o1js right? The latest is 9d old @DFST yeah?

Probably yes, but it is just the first part - internal changes, so we will see no difference at this stage in our programs. But it is good that the process has started, and the o1js team has a good track record of delivering what is started fast.
No doubts there 👍

I think I'll land it mid next week or so.
Will be a nasty change though - breaks everything.
Everything must be async from then on

Will read() and write() functions in Cache.FileSystem also became async?
https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1252

messages.content: Nope sorry @DFST - that would need an additional Pickles refactor, not started
